name: Sara's Truth
description:
Sara's Truth is an original graphic novel set in modern day Iran, exploring how the internet and social networking has changed the way news and information are exchanged around the world.

In 2009, the Iranian election was won by Mahmoud Ahmadinejad admist must controversy. It was suspected by many that the election was rigged, and many spoke out against the alleged corruption swallowing Iran.

The graphic novel tells the story of Abdul, whose blog tells the world the story of Iran from the people, and his young sister Sara, who grows up in the world that Abdul is trying to fight against.

As Abdul uses the internet to spread his message, Sara chases a balloon through the city, observing first hand the life of an Iranian citizen in these troubled times.

Can one man make a difference when given a big enough soapbox? Is this the world for his sister to grow up in?

What is the truth?

48 pages (32 of story, 16 of extras), black and white, nominated for "Best Artwork at the 2010 UWS Showcase".
